trans-unit.source: Adding resources to an Azure resource group
trans-unit.target: Adding resources to an Azure resource group

trans-unit.source: Learn how to add resources to an Azure Resource Group by using Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to add resources to an Azure Resource Group by using Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Adding resources to an Azure resource group
trans-unit.target: Adding resources to an Azure resource group

trans-unit.source: If you need to add more resources to a resource group, you can do this in the JSON Outline window in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: If you need to add more resources to a resource group, you can do this in the JSON Outline window in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Adding resources to a resource group
trans-unit.target: Adding resources to a resource group

trans-unit.source: To add resources to a resource group
trans-unit.target: To add resources to a resource group

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, choose the JSON file for the Azure resource group.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, choose the JSON file for the Azure resource group.

trans-unit.source: The JSON file appears in the editor, and the **JSON Outline** window also appears next to the editor.
trans-unit.target: The JSON file appears in the editor, and the **JSON Outline** window also appears next to the editor.

trans-unit.source: If you close the JSON Outline window, it won't automatically open again until you choose the Show Outline command on the context menu of a JSON template file (not a parameters file).
trans-unit.target: If you close the JSON Outline window, it won't automatically open again until you choose the Show Outline command on the context menu of a JSON template file (not a parameters file).

trans-unit.source: JSON file for Azure resource group
trans-unit.target: JSON file for Azure resource group

trans-unit.source: In the **JSON Outline** window, choose the **resources** node, and then either choose the **Add New Resource** command on the context menu, or choose the **Add Resource** button at the top of the JSON Outline window.
trans-unit.target: In the **JSON Outline** window, choose the **resources** node, and then either choose the **Add New Resource** command on the context menu, or choose the **Add Resource** button at the top of the JSON Outline window.

trans-unit.source: Adding a new resource to resource group
trans-unit.target: Adding a new resource to resource group

trans-unit.source: In the list of resources in the **Add Resource** dialog box, choose the resource you want to add, provide the information required by the resource, and then choose the **Add** button.
trans-unit.target: In the list of resources in the **Add Resource** dialog box, choose the resource you want to add, provide the information required by the resource, and then choose the **Add** button.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you add a storage account, you need to provide a base name for the parameters that will be created for you.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you add a storage account, you need to provide a base name for the parameters that will be created for you.

trans-unit.source: Add Resource dialog box
trans-unit.target: Add Resource dialog box

trans-unit.source: The resource is added to the resources lists in the **JSON Outline** window, and the new JSON representing the resource appears in the file.
trans-unit.target: The resource is added to the resources lists in the **JSON Outline** window, and the new JSON representing the resource appears in the file.

trans-unit.source: Related parameters and/or variables may also be added.
trans-unit.target: Related parameters and/or variables may also be added.

trans-unit.source: Deploy the new resource to the Azure resource group.
trans-unit.target: Deploy the new resource to the Azure resource group.

trans-unit.source: On the context menu of the resource group project in Solution Explorer, choose **Deploy** and then choose the name of the resource group.
trans-unit.target: On the context menu of the resource group project in Solution Explorer, choose **Deploy** and then choose the name of the resource group.

trans-unit.source: Azure resource group deployed
trans-unit.target: Azure resource group deployed

trans-unit.source: The **Deploy to Resource Group** dialog box appears.
trans-unit.target: The **Deploy to Resource Group** dialog box appears.

trans-unit.source: Choose the **Deploy** button.
trans-unit.target: Choose the **Deploy** button.

trans-unit.source: If any parameters need to be specified by you, the **Edit Parameters** dialog box appears.
trans-unit.target: If any parameters need to be specified by you, the **Edit Parameters** dialog box appears.

trans-unit.source: Enter any required values and then choose the **Save** button.
trans-unit.target: Enter any required values and then choose the **Save** button.

trans-unit.source: The new resource is deployed to your Azure resource group.
trans-unit.target: The new resource is deployed to your Azure resource group.

trans-unit.source: See Also
trans-unit.target: See Also

trans-unit.source: Creating and Deploying Azure Resource Group Deployment Projects
trans-unit.target: Creating and Deploying Azure Resource Group Deployment Projects

trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager Cmdlets

trans-unit.target: Using Windows PowerShell with Azure Resource Manager

trans-unit.target: Channel9 Video: Azure Resource Manager
